meanings.definition: To make audible or capable of being heard.
meanings.sent1: She was audibilizing her speech for the hard-of-hearing audience.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was audibilizing the instructions for the students at the back of the class.
meanings.sent3: The magician audibilized the secret code for the audience to hear.
meanings.sent4: The wind audibilized its presence through the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock audibilized its annoying beep to wake me up.

meanings.definition: The act of making something audible or capable of being heard.
meanings.sent1: His audibilizing of the music made the party more lively.
meanings.sent2: The audibilizing of the recorded interview helped in transcribing it accurately.
meanings.sent3: The audibilizing of the baby's laughter brought joy to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The audibilizing of the news report spread the information quickly.
meanings.sent5: The audibilizing of the bird's chirping signaled the start of a new day.
